intro: Selago lamprocarpa, commonly known as the silverleaf lily, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking silver-green foliage. The plant produces showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Selago lamprocarpa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to bloom reliably in suitable conditions.
